title: Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Resignation Hints at Divisions in Trump’s Movement
summary: As the president forced a onetime loyalist from Congress, her defiant departure signaled a coming debate over Republican identity in a post-Trump era.

title: For Marjorie Taylor Greene, a Rough Education in MAGA Politics
summary: The Georgia congresswoman strove to be both the ultimate Trump warrior and to be taken seriously. She wound up in political exile.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Exit Deals a Blow to Republicans’ Majority in Congress
summary: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene’s sudden resignation underscored the fragility of the G.O.P. majority, and exposed deep discontent on the right going into the midterm elections.

title: Georgia Voters Stand by Marjorie Taylor Greene After She Stood Up to Trump
summary: Ms. Greene’s resignation blindsided her conservative Georgia district, which had stuck by her through ups and downs, including her split with the president.

title: The Federalist Society Is Torn Between Its Legal Philosophy and Trump’s Demands
summary: Guided by Leonard Leo, the society built a pipeline for traditional conservative judges. But that might not be enough for President Trump in his second term.

title: In the House, Censures Proliferate, Reflecting a Poisonous Climate
summary: Formal reprimands, once rare, dominated the chamber’s agenda this week, prompting lawmakers in both parties to call for changes to the way the House handles such actions.

title: As Democrats Look to a New Generation, John Larson Hangs On
summary: The 77-year-old Connecticut Democrat is facing primary challenges from people who say he’s too old and has been around too long. He says his age and experience are his strength.

title: In Russian-Occupied Mariupol, Everything Ukrainian Must Go
summary: Russia is remaking Mariupol, which was devastated by a brutal siege in 2022. Ukrainians seeking to move back are finding it hard to recognize the city, or to reclaim their property.

title: Russian Exiles See Europe Visa Rule as Blow Against Them, Not Putin
summary: The European Union said the decision was prompted by sabotage attacks in Europe, but Russians living abroad say Europe is punishing ordinary people.

title: Tatiana Schlossberg, John F. Kennedy’s Granddaughter, Reveals Terminal Cancer Diagnosis
summary: Tatiana Schlossberg, a daughter of Caroline Kennedy, revealed a terminal cancer diagnosis in an essay published on the anniversary of her grandfather’s assassination.

title: The Battle Between Pasadena and U.C.L.A Over the Rose Bowl
summary: The storied stadium is at the center of a battle between Pasadena and U.C.L.A. that’s about money, nostalgia, geography and so much more.

title: The Real Epstein Cover-Up
summary: Once again, we see how far this country will go to maintain the power of men at the expense of women’s bodies.

title: Anorexia Was My Revolt Against Mother Nature
summary: My sister and I went on a joint diet. She stopped and I didn’t.

title: A Swath of Bank Customer Data Was Hacked. The F.B.I. Is Investigating.
summary: SitusAMC, a technology vendor for real estate lenders, holds sensitive personal information on the clients of hundreds of its banking customers, including JPMorgan Chase.

title: 20 Killed in Israeli Strikes as Israel and Hamas Trade Blame Over Truce
summary: Violence has repeatedly flared up in the weeks since a cease-fire was reached, killing hundreds of Palestinians and at least three Israeli soldiers.

title: Lemurs in Madagascar Face an Unexpected Killer
summary: Thousands of the endangered primates end up on the dinner plates of people in the upper rung of the country’s society who have money to spare.

title: Dorothy Vogel, Librarian With a Vast Art Collection, Dies at 90
summary: On modest civil servants’ salaries, she and her husband amassed a trove of some 4,000 works by art-world luminaries, storing them in their one-bedroom Manhattan apartment.
